Package reso.scheduler

Class Scheduler

java.lang.Object
reso.scheduler.AbstractScheduler
reso.scheduler.Scheduler
public class Scheduler extends AbstractScheduler
This class is the core of the simulator. It keeps an ordered list of events, according to their scheduled time of occurence.

  • Field Summary

    Fields inherited from class reso.scheduler.AbstractScheduler

    numEventsProcessed, numEventsScheduled, time

  • Constructor Details

    • Scheduler

      public Scheduler​(boolean stopOnError)
      Creates a Scheduler that can optionally stop on error.
      Parameters:
      stopOnError - defines if the simulator must stop when a scheduled event generates an exception.

    • Scheduler

      public Scheduler()
      Creates a Scheduler. This version of the constructor generates a Scheduler that will not stop when an event throws an exception.
      See Also:
      Scheduler(boolean)

  • Method Details

    • schedule

      public void schedule​(AbstractEvent evt)
      Schedule an event. It is forbidden to schedule an event before the current scheduler's time. Scheduling an event in the past causes an exception to be thrown.
      Specified by:
      schedule in class AbstractScheduler
      Parameters:
      evt - is the event to be scheduled.

    • hasMoreEvents

      public boolean hasMoreEvents()
      Test if more events are scheduled.
      Specified by:
      hasMoreEvents in class AbstractScheduler

    • runNextEvent

      public void runNextEvent()
      Run the next event, that is
      1. pop the closest event in the future,
      2. advance the simulated time to that event's time of occurence, and
      3. run the event's callback.
      Specified by:
      runNextEvent in class AbstractScheduler

    • dumpEvents

      public void dumpEvents()
      Print every event remaining in the queue. This can be useful for debugging purposes.
